title: `PhantomData<fn()>` is unstable in `const fn`

labels.name: T-lang
labels.description: Relevant to the language team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-const-fn
labels.description: Area: const fn foo(..) {..}. Pure functions which can be applied at compile time.

labels.name: C-feature-request
labels.description: Category: A feature request, i.e: not implemented / a PR.

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I tried this code:

```rust
use core::marker::PhantomData;

const fn test() {
    let _: PhantomData<fn()> = PhantomData;
}
```
([playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=ceabf86e4f62df0dc2886678c88c0381))

I expected it to work, but it doesn't work.

Error:
```
error[E0723]: function pointers in const fn are unstable
 --> src/lib.rs:4:32
  |
4 |     let _: PhantomData<fn()> = PhantomData;
  |                                ^^^^^^^^^^^
  |
  = note: see issue #57563 <https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/57563> for more information
  = help: add `#![feature(const_fn)]` to the crate attributes to enable
```

I use `PhantomData<fn(T) -> T>` to make type invariant over `T` & mark that I don't own `T`. I see no reason for this code to be unstable.
